decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The materials used in the construction of the development shall match those used to construct The adjoining house, 47 Bath Road.

Condition : 3 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (45bathroad/2022/01; 45bathroad/2022/02; 45bathroad/2022/04;received 20 August 2022; and 45bathroad/2022/07 received 8 March 2022) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 1995 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order) no enlargement of the premises or any additional structures/buildings within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out.

Condition : 5 - No additional windows or other glazed openings shall be formed in the flank walls of the house hereby approved and no additional doors inserted in the building without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 7 - The ground floor of the house hereby approved shall be constructed with a level threshold and a doorway width sufficient to allow access for a wheelchair user.  The bathroom shall be laid out to provide adequate transfer zones for a wheelchair user to access the bath/shower and toilet  and the ground floor layout shall meet Building Regulation M4(3) part 2(a) to 'allow simple adaption of the dwelling to meet the needs of occupants who use wheelchairs.'

Condition : 8 - No development shall take place above ground level until the applicant has entered into a binding arrangement with the Council to make an agreed contribution to the Council's Carbon Offset Fund, in accordance with the zero carbon strategy set out in the Energy Statement hereby approved to an amount that equates to the shortfall in required energy savings to meet the 'zero carbon' target.

Condition : 9 - Before the house hereby approved is first occupied, the forecourt of the property shall be laid to grass and flowerbeds and have a pedestrian access in a permeable surface and so retained permanently.  The forecourt shall be enclosed by a front wall not exceeding 600 mm high, and a pedestrian gateway 1.2 metres wide.  The forecourt shall not be used for parking vehicles.

Condition : 10 - All new hard surfaces constructed on site, either as part of the approved development or as installed later, shall comprise permeable surfaces that enable surface water to drain into the subsoil on the site and adjacent land.  All rainwater downpipes shall be equipped with water butts of not less than 210 litres in capacity and these shall be retained permanently.

Condition : 11 - Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105 Litres per person per day or less.

Condition : 12 - The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development meets the following:
o	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) have achieved a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
o	At least 50% of timber and timber products have been sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
o	No construction or insulation materials have been used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 13 - Before any further work takes place on site, the developer shall carry out a survey of the condition of the highway and footway within 20 metres of the site to establish any pre-existing damage of the pavement and carriageway and shall submit the same to the Council's highways contractor with a ciopy to the local planning authority for information.
During works, an appropriate wheel-washing system shall be operated to remove mud, stones and other extraneous materials from vehicle wheels and chassis' leaving the site, and all departing loads shall be fully covered to ensure no material is deposited on the highway. The exit from the wheel wash shall be a hard, non-porous surface sited as far away from the exit as is possible given the site constraints and kept clean at all times.  Waste water discharged from the wheel wash shall be stored and disposed of on site and not discharged into the public sewer unless soil, stones and any suspended material have first been removed.
The developer shall ensure that no dust or other debris is carried on to adjoining properties in accordance with the guidance at https://www.london.gov.uk/file/18750/download?token=zV3ZKTpP. 
Site lighting shall be designed, positioned and directed so as not to unnecessarily intrude on passing drivers or direct light into any neighbouring windows in accordance with the guidance provided by the Institute of Lighting Engineers Guidance Note: For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light 2021.
All vehicle arrivals and departures shall be supervised and the condition of the highway examined immediately afterwards.  Any materials shed from the vehicle during such movement shall be immediately removed from the highway, and returned to site or carted away for disposal and shall not be washed into the surface water drainage system

Condition : 14 - Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development provision shall be made on site for the storage of waste and recycling materials on the forecourt.  The refuse bins shall be enclosed in a roofed timber proprietary refuse store not exceeding 1.3 metre high, 1.5 metres wide and one metre deep, with closable front doors
